subject: Swine Influenza
Soccer
lead_paragraph: All 176 professional soccer matches in Mexico will be played behind closed doors this weekend in response to the swine flu outbreak that is suspected in the deaths of 160 people in Mexico. Six top-division matches — normally seen only on pay-for-view TV — will be available on free channels. Officials estimated clubs would lose $2 million in ticket sales alone, their primary source of revenue.
